1024x768 Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE MicrosoftInternetExplorer4 Hi Larry,
Per Steves email, I wanted to reach out and introduce myself as the person who will be able to answer your questions about the MBO Program. I would love to set up a time to speak with you so I have attached a link to my time trade calendar below, so you may select a time that is convenient for you to speak.
https://my.timedriver.com/9TGRK.
I look forward to speaking with you,
Nicolette
Nicolette Taylor Business Manager MBO Partners
t: 703.793.6281 f: 703.793.6456 e: ntaylor@mbopartners.com w: www.mbopartners.com
Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com and permanently delete the e-mail and files.
From: Steve Arhancet Sent: Saturday, October 01, 2011 2:30 PM To: lrc@red4est.com Cc: Nicolette Taylor Subject: RE: w-2 contracting
Larry,
Thank you for contacting us. I am currently working on the implementation of a new account for MBO, Nicolette Taylor, one of our Consultant Advisors will reach out to you to answer your questions. You can also reach her at ntaylor@mbopartners.com
Regards,
Steve
___________________________________ Steve Arhancet Director, Enrollments and Market Development MBO Partners
t: 703.793.6011 f: 703.793.6081 m: 540.560.8837 e: sarhancet@mbopartners.com w: www.mbopartners.com
Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com and permanently delete the e-mail and files.
From: Steve Arhancet Sent: Friday, September 30, 2011 9:04 PM To: Steve Arhancet Subject: Fwd: w-2 contracting
Sent from my iPhone
Begin forwarded message: From: Larry Colen <lrc@red4est.com> Date: September 29, 2011 3:47:20 AM EDT To: Steve Arhancet <sarhancet@mbopartners.com> Subject: Fwd: w-2 contracting Steve,
Sue Toorans suggested I get in touch with you. I just picked up a contracting gig, and while EDD seems willing to forgive a little bit of 1099 work, I don't want to risk my ability to collect unemployment. Plus, when it comes down to it, paperwork just isn't what I'm good at.
Apparently, your cut is about 5% off the top. What is the lag time between the company paying you, and you paying me? How would I set it up between you and them?
Larry
Begin forwarded message: From: Sue Toorans <suetoo@svpal.org> Date: September 28, 2011 7:46:24 PM PDT To: Larry Colen <lrc@red4est.com> Subject: Re: w-2 contracting
I go through mbopartners.com. My contact is Steve Arhancet (703-793-6011) sarhancet@mbopartners.com . If you sign up, please tell them I sent you. They handle all the paperwork of a contract, once you've landed it. They send the correct amount of dollars to the correct taxing agencies. They offer medical and dental (for a fee) and do a bunch more. For this service, they only charge 5% of the first $125k per year. Their percentage goes down for monies over 125k in a year.
--- Sue
On Wed, 28 Sep 2011, Larry Colen wrote:
Yes, I am interested in learning about the w-2 contract house.
Larry
-- Larry Colen lrc@red4est.com sent from i4est
--
Sue
I never met something shiny I didn't like www.FeatherweightFinery.com
-- Larry Colen lrc@red4est.com sent from i4est
